posts.name: Sulaksh Patnaik
posts.cooked:
Can anyone please guide how to retrieve data from the API token given by sir (TORONTO:100)
like what are the steps to follow?
i tried doing it with help of python using requests module but always end up getting errors like “failed to retrieve data”.

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
“from the API token given by sir” - If you mean the LLM token, that’s unrelated.
Github token is not the same as LLM token (that is required for the Week 5 module, not this project).
(a) With regards to Github token, first do a few tests in the browser just to get the query string right (which btw, does not require any github token). There could be something incorrect in the way you’ve formed your query string.
(b) If the above is not the reason and you believe you formed the query string right, print the query string in your program and paste that on the browser and see if you can debug more.
(c) You may have to enable specific fine grained access to the github token. But this does not appear to be the reason since you mentioned the token for module 5 (which is not the same as the github personal acces token which you need to generate yourself from your github account )

posts.name: Sulaksh Patnaik
posts.cooked:
Ohh god thats a huge blunder i made, its so ludicrous of me to think that as an API token, thanks for mentioning it!

where do i get the API for the project, in my mail this is the only API provided to me!

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked: If you visit the project page, there is a link at the top where you can refer to the Github api documentation.

posts.name: Sulaksh Patnaik
posts.cooked:
All right thanks!
the token is given within the documentation? like specifically where can i find it?

posts.name: Bahni Roy
posts.cooked:
Not in any documention. You need to create one for yourself. For reference please refer to any short video from the list:
How to generate a Github Personal Access Token

link_counts.title: How to Generate a Github personal access token - Google Search

posts.name: Sulaksh Patnaik
posts.cooked: i have generated PAT now how to access the toronto 100 dataset?

posts.cooked:
